justification: “Participants rated how likely they would be to choose each option… Likelihood to choose was rated on a scale of 0 to 100 percent.”

measured_by: Thought-about frequency 0–10 scale / Talked-about frequency 0–10 scale (summed)
justification: “Participants reported how much they thought about (i.e., mentally simulated) and talked about (i.e., socially simulated) each option…using two separate rating scales from 0 (‘Not at all’) to 10 (‘All the time’). The sum…was taken as the overall everyday simulation score.”

measured_by: Positive valence 0–10 scale / Negative valence 0–10 scale (reverse-scored & summed)
justification: “Participants rated the positive and negative valence of each option…on separate scales from 0 (‘Not at all’) to 10 (‘Extremely’). These were combined into an overall valence score.”
